entry.name: dialog
entry.title: Dialog Widget
entry.desc: Open content in an interactive overlay.

longdesc.p: A dialog is a floating window that contains a title bar and a content area. The dialog window can be moved, resized and closed with the 'x' icon by default.
If the content length exceeds the maximum height, a scrollbar will automatically appear.
A bottom button bar and semi-transparent modal overlay layer are common options that can be added.
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

option.name: autoOpen
option.desc: If set to true, the dialog will automatically open upon initialization. If false, the dialog will stay hidden until the open method is called.

option.name: buttons
option.desc: Specifies which buttons should be displayed on the dialog. The keys are the button labels and the values are the callbacks for when the associated button is clicked. The context of the callback is the dialog element; if you need access to the button, it is available as the target of the event object.

option.name: buttons
option.desc: Specifies which buttons should be displayed on the dialog. Each element of the array must be an object defining the attributes, properties, and event handlers to set on the button.

option.name: closeOnEscape
option.desc: Specifies whether the dialog should close when it has focus and the user presses the esacpe (ESC) key.

option.name: closeText
option.desc: Specifies the text for the close button. Note that the close text is visibly hidden when using a standard theme.

option.name: dialogClass
option.desc: The specified class name(s) will be added to the dialog, for additional theming.

option.name: draggable
option.desc: If set to true, the dialog will be draggable by the title bar. Requires the jQuery UI Draggable wiget to be included.

option.name: height
option.desc: The height of the dialog, in pixels. Specifying "auto" is also supported to make the dialog adjust based on its content.

option.name: hide
option.desc: The effect to be used when the dialog is closed.

option.name: maxHeight
option.desc: The maximum height to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

option.name: maxWidth
option.desc: The maximum width to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

option.name: minHeight
option.desc: The minimum height to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

option.name: minWidth
option.desc: The minimum width to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

option.name: modal
option.desc: If set to true, the dialog will have modal behavior; other items on the page will be disabled, i.e., cannot be interacted with. Modal dialogs create an overlay below the dialog but above other page elements.

option.name: position
option.desc:
Specifies where the dialog should be displayed. Possible values:
1) a single string representing position within viewport: 'center', 'left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom'.
2) an array containing an x,y coordinate pair in pixel offset from left, top corner of viewport (e.g. [350,100])
3) an array containing x,y position string values (e.g. ['right','top'] for top right corner).

option.name: resizable
option.desc: If set to true, the dialog will be resizable. Requires the jQuery UI Resizable widget to be included.

option.name: show
option.desc: The effect to be used when the dialog is opened.

option.name: stack
option.desc: Specifies whether the dialog will stack on top of other dialogs. This will cause the dialog to move to the front of other dialogs when it gains focus.

option.name: title
option.desc: Specifies the title of the dialog. Any valid HTML may be set as the title. The title can also be specified by the title attribute on the dialog source element.

option.name: width
option.desc: The width of the dialog, in pixels.

option.name: zIndex
option.desc: The starting z-index for the dialog.

event.name: beforeClose
event.desc: Triggered when a dialog is about to close. If canceled, the dialog will not close.

event.name: open
event.desc: Triggered when the dialog is opened.

event.name: focus
event.desc: Triggered when the dialog gains focus.

event.name: dragStart
event.desc: Triggered when the user starts dragging the dialog.

property.name: offset

event.name: drag

event.name: dragStop
